sentences.sContent: ...in the 1960s, when sexual love had been divested of sin.
sentences.sCn: ...在二十世纪60年代，性爱不再被当做犯罪的年代。

sentences.sContent: They have divested rituals of their original meaning.
sentences.sCn: 这些仪式的原意已被他们丧尽。

remMethod.val: di(去掉) + vest(穿衣) → 脱去衣服， 摆脱束缚 → 剥夺

trans.tranOther: If something or someone is divested of a particular quality, they lose that quality or it is taken away from them
